task.title: Deleting an SNMP community by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete SNMP communities by using the delete command on the command line.

context.p: You can delete an SNMP community by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to delete an SNMP community, see .
context.note:
You cannot delete an SNMP community if it is use by an SNMP trap subscriber.
The command must be capitalized as shown, and must use the double quotation marks as shown.

step.cmd: To delete an SNMP community, enter the following command:

info.note: The command must be capitalized as shown, and must use the double quotation marks as shown.
info.p:
Where:
snmpcommunityName Specifies the name of the SNMP community that you want to delete.

example.p: The following example shows deleting an SNMP community that is called community1: delete SNMPCommunity "Name=community1" The requested configuration change has completed successfully.
